results.title: Shock
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Utilising a number of scenario accident sequences, this program highlights the common factor to all injuries - Shock. Defines shock and examines actual and relative fluid loss. Looks at signs and symptoms and explains emergency treatment. Emphasises that shock is an ongoing process which must be treated and stopped.

results.title: Altered consciousness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Examines and defines the altered consciousness state and the problems it causes, in particular, the patient being unable to recognise and thus react to dangers either external e.g. fire, or internal e.g. blocked airway. Looks at Epilepsy, diabetes and head injuries as specific examples. Emergency treatment included . WARNING-The Epilepsy Foundation of Victoria has advised that this program contains outdated information and shows practices no longer followed.

results.title: Heart Attacks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Explains the oxygen supply to the heart. Examines various abnormal heart conditions. Signs and symptoms for angina and coronary occlusion and emergency treatment required.

results.title: Airway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Explains the anatomy of the upper and lower airway and, how simply it can become partially or totally blocked; the signs and symptoms of a partially blocked and totally blocked airway and the emergency treatment required under both conditions.

results.title: Burns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Causes and types of burns. Emergency treatment required. Looks closely at the treatment of a burnt leg and examines the situation of burns around the head and neck area which may have a serious effect on the patient’s ability to breathe. Treatment of the patient’s emotional state.

results.title: Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Function, location and anatomy of heart. Explains pulse and where to locate. With resuscitation model explains external compression and moves onto cardio-pulmonary resuscitation, firstly with one rescuer and then two rescuers. Based on the method taught by the Australian resuscitation council.

results.title: Black Sunday
results.brief_description: Depicts the devastation caused by the notorious ‘Black Sunday’ bushfires of 1926, that wiped out the south-east of Victoria.

results.title: Biscuits by the million
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: This is story of biscuit manufacture in a modern factory of the 50’s. The flour, sugar and milk that forms the basic dough of every biscuit is mixed, kneaded, rolled, stretched and stamped, and ready for final baking in a long oven through which biscuits pass continuously. When cooled they are packed in tins, the only operation carried out by hand. Most of the biscuits are consumed locally, although a percentage are exported to other parts of the world.

results.title: Birth: a film about feelings and experiences
results.creator_credit: Julian Aston, Julian Aston Productions and National Childbirth Trust
results.brief_description: A film in which women discuss their emotional response to childbirth as well as the physical experience. The importance of prenatal exercises is discussed and an actual birth is shown.
